text:
I’m having trouble with the HubDb API not showing new rows added via the API, until I manually go in and press Update. I’m not using the /draft path, I’m going directly to:
`$hubdb_url = '<https://api.hubapi.com/hubdb/api/v2/tables/695248/rows?hapikey=>' . KEY;`
The view from the HubDb main view shows the correct Updated time as the POST API call, Updated by “-”, and the correct number of rows, but the GET API call only returns the old items. Then, when I go into the table and press “Update”, none of the information shown in that view changes but the GET returns the new row
Can you DM a link to the table?

Deploying a bunch of optimizations/fixes for publishing and reverting tables. For large tables, you should see up to a 10x improvement in speed for these operations. Let me know if you see anything unusual
